Description.val:
This program provides for Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE), procurement and installation of AN/SRQ-4(Ku) field install kits.  This system encompasses hardware and software to transmit sensor data from the Light Airborne Multi-Purpose System (LAMPS) MK III aircraft to the host ship classes (cruisers, destroyers, and frigates).  The minimum sustaining production rate is 4 kits per Fiscal Year.

Program spares are budgeted by NAVSEA OPN BLI 9020.

Justification.val:
The FY14 request funds the procurement of 5 AN/SRQ-4(Ku) ship units and associated support to meet the MH-60R fleet deployment schedule.  The data funding supports Ship Installation Documentation and Ship Change Proposals on multiple CG and DDG class ships scheduled for shipcheck and modernization changes as part of the fielding plan.

FY12 is below minimum sustaining productions rate. This lower rate is sustainable for one year only.

Support costs increase in FY14 is due to increased kit quantities in production from FY13 to FY14, specific training equipment required for initial outfitting and increase in interim contractor support.

Name.@footnote: N86 CDL Hawklink Ship Radar Cross Section Signature Improvement letter (11 May 2011) as well as emergent requirement to integrate Fiber Optic Data Multiplex System & Navigational Sensor Interface to allow communication with Cruiser-Destroyer ships provides justification to realign funds to NRE in FY12-13 to accomplish directed mission. Notes for installation schedule:      1. Ship Installations are phased as follows:    FY12 procurements: (3) Q2 FY15     FY13 procurements: (2) Q3 FY15; (1) Q4 FY15; (2) Q1 FY16     FY14 procurements: (1) Q2 FY16; (1) Q3 FY16; (3) Q4 FY16       FY15 procurements: (2) Q2 FY17; (3) Q3 FY17; (3) Q4 FY17     FY16 procurements: (2) Q2 FY18; (3) Q3 FY18; (3) Q4 FY18 2. Installations are subject to changes in ship availability schedules. 3. Installation unit costs have been updated to reflect estimates based on actual costs on FY12 first completed DDG install (USS WAYNE E. MEYER). 4. Unit costs vary due to ship class, hull and configuration.

Description.val: This program provides for non-recurring engineering, procurement and associated installation and support of AN/SRQ-4(Ku) field install kits.  This system encompasses hardware and software to transmit sensor data from the Light Airborne Multi-Purpose System (LAMPS) MK III MH-60R aircraft to the host ship classes.
